title: When do you use commas in sentences? - Quora

response.answer_text: Commas have about a dozen different uses, more than any other punctuation mark. Here are some of them (with examples): Use a comma before the conjunction in a compound sentence: Some people think commas serve no purpose and should be eliminated from written English, but such people are idjits.Use commas to separate items in a list: My usual ways of dealing with stress are drinking coffee, listening to music, and writing fiction.Use a comma to separate a direct address from the rest of the sentence: No matter what anyone online tells you, kid, punctuation does matter.Use a comma after the year when writing a date: Calliope became a housecat in January of 2011, and has been a fluffy couch potato ever since.Use a comma after the name of a city when writing the names of city and state: That weird guy who blogs about grammar and such lives in Portales, New Mexico.The web site Grammar Girl has (as always) a thorough and sensible explanation for how to use commas: Where Do I Use Commas? Or you could read what that weird guy who blogs about grammar has to say on this topic: Commas
Use commas to separate words and word groups in a simple series. Commas are used between the adjectives, phrases, claues and between the two sentences.
